Key Match Events: Severino pitched a strong game, allowing just one run over seven innings.
Francisco Lindor reached base three times, scored a run, and drove in another.
Brandon Nimmo made a diving catch that went for a one-out triple.
Jarren Duran singled through a drawn-in infield to tie the game at 1-1.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets won their fifth straight game to get within a half game of the idle Braves for the final NL wild-card spot.
Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the team's resilience and importance of the remaining games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets' home crowd of 35,149 was their highest attendance without a fan giveaway since June 26.
Severino's performance was crucial in starting the critical six-game homestand.
